snippet: Richard Linklater’s film helped achieve freedom for Bernie Tiede on bond, pending review of a plan that could reduce his sentence for shooting a widow in Texas to time served.
abstract: Panola County, Tex, judge orders temporary release of Bernie Tiede, who was convicted of murdering an 81-year-old companion in 1996 and sentenced to life in prison; release is granted pending review by an appellate court of a plan that could reduce Tiede's sentence to time served; order occurs after lawyer, inspired by Richard Linklater film Bernie, turned up new evidence in case.

byline.original: By MICHAEL CIEPLY and DAVID MONTGOMERY
byline.contributor: David Montgomery reported from Austin, Tex.

lead_paragraph: Richard Linklater’s film helped achieve freedom for Bernie Tiede on bond, pending review of a plan that could reduce his sentence for shooting a widow in Texas to time served.

headline.main: Convicted Murderer Who Inspired Film ‘Bernie’ Is Released to Director’s Garage
headline.print_headline: Murderer Who Inspired the Film ‘Bernie’ Is Released to the Director’s Garage
